judy kaufmann unveils wearable art for literature lovers

Barcelona-based illustrator Judy Kaufmann has unveiled a new collection of enamel pins designed to spark joy and inspiration for literature lovers. Titled A Book to Wear, the collection pays homage to iconic authors and their enduring works with illustrations nodding to the beloved book covers, alongside portraits of their writers. The accessories have been crafted with durable, high-quality materials and are intended for everyday use, with their striking designs catering to readers, art enthusiasts, and those who cherish creativity in all its forms. By merging her colorful illustration style with a tribute to celebrated authors, Kaufmann creates wearable art that speaks directly to bibliophiles and creatives alike.


all images courtesy of Judy Kaufmann

a book to wear honors iconic authors and their writing

‘This whole collection has been created for people who love reading, music, and arts, and it’s a way to honor the many artists and authors who are part of our lives,’ says the artist. The collection’s pins celebrate a diverse range of writers, from classics like Lewis Carroll, John Steinbeck, and Mary Shelley to contemporary figures such as Rebecca Solnit, Art Spiegelman, and Annie Ernaux. Featured authors also include Truman Capote, Patricia Highsmith, Joan Didion, and Toni Morrison, for a diverse array of literary representation. With earlier designs in the series, Judy Kaufmann honored legends such as Herman Melville, Harper Lee, Virginia Woolf, Jack Kerouac, and more, solidifying her dedication to showcasing literary brilliance across the eras.

The pins, artistic and practical, can be safely pinned to jackets, backpacks, or book bags, remaining intact even through a trip to the washing machine. Their robust construction ensures that they retain their charm and vibrancy over time. A Book to Wear is sold exclusively through independent bookstores, reinforcing a connection between readers and local literary hubs.
